values.name: localsheet
values.comment:
Include Bulma 0.7.1 in your Elm project.

    import Bulma.CDN exposing (localsheet)

    view : Model -> Html msg
    view model =
        div []
            [ stylesheet "mycustom.css"
            , text "wow!"
            ]
values.type: String.String -> Html.Html msg

values.name: stylesheet
values.comment:
Include Bulma 0.7.1 in your Elm project.

    import Bulma.CDN exposing (stylesheet)

    view : Model -> Html msg
    view model =
        div []
            [ stylesheet
            , text "wow!"
            ]
values.type: Html.Html msg

name: Bulma.Columns

aliases.name: ColumnModifiers
aliases.comment:
The `widths` field requires a `Maybe Width` for each device size.
`Nothing` will create a narrow column for that device range.

aliases.name: ColumnsModifiers
aliases.type: { multiline : Basics.Bool, gap : Bulma.Columns.Gap, display : Bulma.Columns.Display, centered : Basics.Bool }

values.name: column
values.comment:
A column element that is meant to be placed in `columns`.

    myColumn : Html msg
    myColumn
      = column myColumnModifiers []
        [ h1 [] [ text "Lorem" ]
        , h2 [] [ text "ipsum" ]
        , h3 [] [ text "dolor" ]
        , h4 [] [ text "sit" ]
        , h5 [] [ text "amet" ]
        ]
values.type: Bulma.Columns.ColumnModifiers -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Bulma.Columns.Column msg

values.name: columnModifiers
values.comment:
Default offsets and widths for an individiual column. 
The offset defaults to `Auto`. Each device defaults to `Just Auto`.
values.type: Bulma.Columns.ColumnModifiers

values.name: columns
values.comment: Make a columnar grid! The widths of all your columns should be no greater than twelve.
values.type: Bulma.Columns.ColumnsModifiers -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Bulma.Columns.Column msg) -> Html.Html msg

values.name: columnsModifiers
values.comment:
Default column attributes.

    myColumnsModifiers : ColumnsModifiers
    myColumnsModifiers 
      = { multiline          = False
        , gapless            = False             
        , display            = TabletAndBeyond
        , centered           = False
        }
    
    myColumnsModifiers == columnsModifiers
values.type: Bulma.Columns.ColumnsModifiers

values.name: narrowColumnModifiers
values.comment:
Default offsets and widths for an individiual column. 
The offset defaults to `Auto`. Each device defaults to `Nothing`.
values.type: Bulma.Columns.ColumnModifiers

name: Bulma.Components

aliases.name: BreadcrumbModifiers
aliases.type: { separator : Bulma.Components.BreadcrumbSeparator, alignment : Bulma.Modifiers.HorizontalAlignment, size : Bulma.Modifiers.Size }

aliases.name: TabsModifiers
aliases.type: { style : Bulma.Components.TabsStyle, alignment : Bulma.Modifiers.HorizontalAlignment, size : Bulma.Modifiers.Size }

values.name: breadcrumb
values.comment:
A navigation thingy.
The first list of attributes is for a `nav.breadcrumb` tag. The second is for an inner `ul` tag.

    type Msg = GoHome
             | GoAway
             | GoTeam

    myBreadCrumb : Html Msg
    myBreadCrumb
      = breadcrumb breadcrumbModifiers [] []
        [ crumblet False [] [ onClick GoHome ]
        , crumblet False [] [ onClick GoAway ]
        , crumblet False [] [ onClick GoTeam ]
        , crumblet True  [] [                ]
        ]
values.type: Bulma.Components.BreadcrumbModifiers -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Bulma.Components.Crumblet msg) -> Bulma.Components.Breadcrumb msg

values.name: breadcrumbModifiers
values.type: Bulma.Components.BreadcrumbModifiers

values.name: card
values.comment:
The card component comprises several elements that you can mix and match.
`card` is the main container for the card-partitions.

    myCard : Html msg
    myCard
      = card []
        [ cardImage   [] []
        , cardContent [] []
        ]
values.type: List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Bulma.Components.CardPartition msg) -> Bulma.Components.Card msg

values.name: cardContent
values.type: List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Bulma.Components.CardPartition msg

values.name: cardFooter
values.comment:
myCardFooter : Html msg
    myCardFooter
      = cardFooter []
        [ cardFooterItemLink [] [ text "Save"   ]
        , cardFooterItemLink [] [ text "Edit"   ]
        , cardFooterItemLink [] [ text "Delete" ]
        ]
values.type: List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Bulma.Components.CardFooterItem msg) -> Bulma.Components.CardPartition msg

values.name: cardFooterItem
values.type: List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Bulma.Components.CardFooterItem msg

values.type: List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Bulma.Components.CardFooterItem msg

values.type: List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Bulma.Components.CardPartition msg

values.name: cardIconLink

values.name: cardImage
values.comment:
import B.Elements exposing (image,imageModifiers)

    myImage : Html msg
    myImage
      = image imageModifiers []
        [ img [ src "http://i.imgur.com/LcvP04R.gif" ] []
        ]

    myCardImage : Html msg
    myCardImage
      = cardImage [] [ myImage ]
values.type: List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Bulma.Elements.Image msg) -> Bulma.Components.CardPartition msg

values.name: cardTitle
values.type: List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Bulma.Components.CardHeaderItem msg

values.name: crumblet
values.comment:
A convenience element for `breadcrumb`.
The first attribute list applies to the outer `li` tag. The second attribute list applies to the inner `a` tag.
values.type: Bulma.Components.IsActive -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Bulma.Components.Crumblet msg

values.name: dropdown
values.comment:
type Msg = ToggleMenu

    myDropdownTrigger : Html Msg
    myDropdownTrigger 
      = dropdownTrigger []
        [ button buttonModifiers 
          [ onClick ToggleMenu 
          , attribute "aria-haspopup" "true"
          , attribute "aria-controls" "dropdown-menu"
          ]
          [ text "Toggle Me"
          ]
        ]

    myDropdownMenu : Html Msg
    myDropdownMenu
      = dropdownMenu [] []
        [ dropdownItem     False [               ] [ text "Cool Birds" ]
        , dropdownDivider        [               ] [                   ]
        , dropdownItemLink False [ href "#duck"  ] [ text "Duck"       ]
        , dropdownItemLink False [ href "#duck"  ] [ text "Duck"       ]
        , dropdownItemLink True  [ href "#goose" ] [ text "Goose"      ]
        ]

    myDropdown : Bool -> Html Msg
    myDropdown isMenuOpen
      = dropdown isMenuOpen dropdownModifiers []
        [ myDropdownTrigger
        , myDropdownMenu
        ]
values.type: Bulma.Components.IsActive -> Bulma.Components.DropdownModifiers -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Bulma.Components.DropdownContent msg) -> Bulma.Components.Dropdown msg

values.name: dropdownDivider
values.comment: An empty `hr.dropdown-divider` element.
values.type: List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Bulma.Components.DropdownItem msg

values.name: dropdownItem
values.comment: A synonym for `div.dropdown-item.is-active`.
values.type: Bulma.Components.IsActive -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Bulma.Components.DropdownItem msg

values.name: dropdownItemLink
values.comment: A synonym for `a.dropdown-item.is-active`.
values.type: Bulma.Components.IsActive -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Bulma.Components.DropdownItem msg

values.name: dropdownMenu
values.comment:
The container for the dropdown's items.
The first attributes list is for the outer `div.dropdown-menu`. The inner list is for the `dropdown-content`.
values.type: List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Bulma.Components.DropdownItem msg) -> Bulma.Components.DropdownContent msg

values.name: dropdownModifiers
values.type: Bulma.Components.DropdownModifiers

values.name: dropdownTrigger
values.comment: The container for the button/link that activates the dropdown menu.
values.type: List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Bulma.Elements.Button msg) -> Bulma.Components.DropdownContent msg

values.name: easyCardHeader
values.comment:
type Msg = ShowCard

    myIcon : Html msg
    myIcon = icon Standard [] [ diamond ] 

    myCardHeader : Html Msg
    myCardHeader
      = easyCardHeader []
        { title       = [ text "4 of Diamonds" ]
        , icon        = [ myIcon               ]
        , onClickIcon = ShowCard
        }
values.type: List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> { title : List.List (Html.Html msg), icon : List.List (Html.Html msg), onClickIcon : msg } -> Bulma.Components.CardPartition msg

type Msg = CloseModal

    myModal : Html Msg
    myModal
      = easyModal True [] CloseModal
        [ text "Your content goes here."
        ]

values.name: fixedNavbar
values.comment:
A sticky variant of `navbar`.
Remember to change your root `<html>` tag to `<html class="has-navbar-fixed-top">` or `<html class="has-navbar-fixed-bottom">`.
values.type: Bulma.Modifiers.VerticalAlignment -> Bulma.Components.NavbarModifiers -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Bulma.Components.NavbarSection msg) -> Bulma.Components.Navbar msg

values.name: menu
values.comment:
Simple menus for vertical navigation.

    myMenu : Html msg
    myMenu
      = menu []
        [ menuLabel [] [ text "General" ]
        , menuList  [] 
          [ menuListItemLink False [] [ text "Dashboard" ]
          , menuListItemLink False [] [ text "Customers" ]
          ]
        , menuLabel [] [ text "Administration" ]
        , menuList  [] 
          [ menuListItem [] 
            [ menuListItemLink False [] [ text "Team Settings" ]
            ]
          , menuListItem [] 
            [ menuListItemLink True [] [ text "Manage Your Team" ]
            , menuList []
              [ menuListItemLink False [] [ text "Members" ]
              ]
            ]
          ]
        ]
values.type: List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Bulma.Components.MenuPart msg) -> Bulma.Components.Menu msg

myModal : Html msg

      = modal True []
        [ modalBackground [] []
        , modalContent []
          [ text "Anything can go here!"
          ]
        , modalClose Large [] []
        ]

values.name: navbar
values.comment:
myNavbarBurger : Html Msg
    myNavbarBurger 
      = navbarBurger isMenuOpen []
        [ span [] []
        , span [] []
        , span [] []
        ]
        
    myNavbarLink : Html Msg
    myNavbarLink 
      = navbarLink [] 
        [ text "More Junk" 
        ]
        
    myNavbar : Bool -> Bool -> Html Msg
    myNavbar isMenuOpen isMenuDropdownOpen
      = navbar navbarModifiers []
        [ navbarBrand [] myNavbarBurger
          [ navbarItem False []
            [ img [ src "https://B.io/images/bulma-logo.png" ] []
            ]
          ]
        , navbarMenu isMenuOpen []
          [ navbarStart [] 
            [ navbarItemLink False [] [ text "Home"  ]
            , navbarItemLink False [] [ text "Blog"    ]
            , navbarItemLink True  [] [ text "Carrots" ]
            , navbarItemLink False [] [ text "About"   ]
            ]
          , navbarEnd [] 
            [ navbarItemDropdown isMenuDropdownOpen Down [] myNavbarLink
              [ navbarDropdown False Left [] 
                [ navbarItemLink False [] [ text "Crud"     ]
                , navbarItemLink False [] [ text "Detritus" ]
                , navbarItemLink True  [] [ text "Refuse"   ]
                , navbarItemLink False [] [ text "Trash"    ]
                ]
              ]
            ]
          ]
        ]
values.type: Bulma.Components.NavbarModifiers -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Bulma.Components.NavbarSection msg) -> Bulma.Components.Navbar msg

values.name: navbarBrand
values.comment:
This is a child of `navbar`, and a sibling to `navbarBrand`.
This element stays to the left side of the `navbar`.
This section is always visible, so try not to place too many links in here -- they'll overflow past the right side of the screen on mobile devices.
values.type: List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> Bulma.Components.NavbarBurger msg -> List.List (Bulma.Components.NavbarItem msg) -> Bulma.Components.NavbarSection msg

values.name: navbarBurger
values.comment:
This is a little hamburger menu icon that only appears on mobile devices, when placed in a `navbarBrand`.
Place empty `span` elements inside to add/subtract numbers of lines.
When its first argument is `True`, it transforms into a `navbarCross`.

    myNavbarBurger : Bool -> Html Msg
    myNavbarBurger isMenuOpen
      = navbarBurger isMenuOpen []
        [ span [] []
        , span [] []
        , span [] []
        ]
values.type: Bulma.Components.IsActive -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Bulma.Components.NavbarBurger msg

values.name: navbarCross
values.comment: A simple "X" character; the active version of `navbarBurger`.
values.type: List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> Bulma.Components.NavbarBurger msg

values.name: navbarDivider
values.comment: A tiny 'lil `hr.navbar-divider`.
values.type: List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Bulma.Components.NavbarItem msg

values.name: navbarDropdown
values.comment:
This is a `div.navbar-dropdown` element.
It is intended to be a child of `navbarItemDropdown`.
When its first argument is `True`, it will add a border on the top of the menu. This is most useful when you're using a transparent menu.
Its second argument determines which side of the button the menu aligns with.
values.type: Bulma.Components.IsBoxed -> Bulma.Modifiers.HorizontalAlignment -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Bulma.Components.NavbarItem msg) -> Bulma.Components.NavbarDropdown msg

values.name: navbarEnd
values.comment:
This element is a child of `navbarMenu`.
On normal screens, this section will appear on the left of the `navbar`.
values.type: List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Bulma.Components.NavbarItem msg) -> Bulma.Components.NavbarSide msg

values.name: navbarItem
values.comment:
This is a synonym for `div.navbar-item`.
You can use this element in `navbarStart`, `navbarEnd`, `navbarBrand`, and `navbarDropdown`.
values.type: Bulma.Components.IsActive -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Bulma.Components.NavbarItem msg

values.name: navbarItemDropdown
values.comment:
This is a dropdown item that expects `navbarLink` and `navbarDropdown` tags.
When the first argument is `True` the menu contents will be visible.
The second argument determines which way its child dropdown opens vertically.
You can use this element in `navbarStart`, `navbarEnd`, `navbarBrand`, and `navbarDropdown`.
values.type: Bulma.Components.IsActive -> Bulma.Modifiers.VerticalDirection -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> Bulma.Components.NavbarLink msg -> List.List (Bulma.Components.NavbarDropdown msg) -> Bulma.Components.NavbarItem msg

values.name: navbarItemLink
values.comment:
This is a synonym for `a.navbar-item`.
You can use this element in `navbarStart`, `navbarEnd`, `navbarBrand`, and `navbarDropdown`.
When the first argument is `True`, the link will be highlighted.
values.type: Bulma.Components.IsActive -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Bulma.Components.NavbarItem msg

values.name: navbarLink
values.comment: This element represents `a.navbar-link`. It is only useful as a child of `navbarDropdown`.
values.type: List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Bulma.Components.NavbarLink msg

values.name: navbarMenu
values.comment:
This is a child of `navbar`, and a sibling to `navbarBrand`.
On small screens, passing `True` to `navbarMenu` will show the mobile-device menu.
Its third argument should be `[ navbarStart [] [], navbarEnd [] [] ]`.
values.type: Bulma.Components.IsActive -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Bulma.Components.NavbarSide msg) -> Bulma.Components.NavbarSection msg

values.name: navbarModifiers
values.type: Bulma.Components.NavbarModifiers

values.name: navbarStart
values.comment:
This element is a child of `navbarMenu`.
On normal screens, this section will appear on the left of the `navbar`.
values.type: List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Bulma.Components.NavbarItem msg) -> Bulma.Components.NavbarSide msg

values.name: pagination
values.comment:
myPagination : Html msg
    myPagination
      = pagination Left []
        [ paginationPrev [] [ text "Previous" ]
        , paginationNext [] [ text "Next"     ]
        , paginationList []
          [ paginationLink False [] [ text "1"  ]
          , paginationEllipsis   [] [           ]
          , paginationLink False [] [ text "45" ]
          , paginationLink True  [] [ text "46" ]
          , paginationLink False [] [ text "47" ]
          , paginationEllipsis   [] [           ]
          , paginationLink False [] [ text "83" ]
          ]
values.type: Bulma.Modifiers.HorizontalAlignment -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Bulma.Components.PaginationPartition msg) -> Bulma.Components.Pagination msg

values.name: paginationEllipsis
values.type: List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Bulma.Components.PaginationListItem msg

values.name: paginationLink
values.type: Bulma.Components.IsCurrent -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Bulma.Components.PaginationListItem msg

values.name: paginationList
values.type: List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Bulma.Components.PaginationListItem msg) -> Bulma.Components.PaginationPartition msg

values.name: paginationNext
values.type: List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Bulma.Components.PaginationPartition msg

values.name: paginationPrev
values.type: List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Bulma.Components.PaginationPartition msg

values.name: panel
values.comment:
myPanel : Html msg
    myPanel
      = panel [] 
        [ panelHeading [] [ text "Repositories" ] 
        , panelBlock False []
          [ controlInput controlInputModifiers [] [] []
          ] 
        , panelTabs []
          [ panelTab False [] [ text "all"     ]
          , panelTab True  [] [ text "public"  ]
          , panelTab True  [] [ text "private" ]
          ]
        , panelLink False [] [ text "bulma"     ]
        , panelLink False [] [ text "marksheet" ]
        , panelLink True  [] [ text "test"      ]
        , panelLink False [] [ text "horsin"    ]
        ]
values.type: List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Bulma.Components.PanelPartition msg) -> Bulma.Components.Panel msg

values.name: panelBlock
values.type: Bulma.Components.IsActive -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Bulma.Components.PanelPartition msg

values.name: panelCheckbox
values.comment:
myPanelBlockAttrs : List (Attribute msg)
    myPanelBlockAttrs = []

    myPanelCheckboxInputAttrs : List (Attribute msg)
    myPanelCheckboxInputAttrs = [ onClick ToggleThing ]

    myPanelLink : Html msg
    myPanelLink 
      = panelLinkWithIcon False 
        myPanelBlockAttrs 
        myPanelCheckboxInputAttrs
        [ text "Remember Me" ]
values.type: Bulma.Components.IsActive -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Bulma.Components.PanelPartition msg

values.name: panelLinkWithIcon
values.comment:
myPanelBlockAttrs : List (Attribute msg)
    myPanelBlockAttrs = []

    myPanelIconAttrs : List (Attribute msg)
    myPanelIconAttrs = []

    myPanelLink : Html msg
    myPanelLink 
      = panelLinkWithIcon False 
        myPanelBlockAttrs 
        myPanelIconAttrs
        [ B.Elements.Icon.book ]
        [ text "github.com/evancz" ]
values.type: Bulma.Components.IsActive -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Bulma.Elements.IconBody msg) -> List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Bulma.Components.PanelPartition msg

values.name: tab

values.name: tabs
values.comment:
myTabs : Html msg
    myTabs
      = tabs myTabsModifiers [] []
        [ tab False [] [] [ text "Pictures" ]
        , tab False [] [] [ text "Music"    ]
        , tab True  [] [] [ text "Videos"   ]
        , tab False [] [] [ text "Docs"     ]
        ]

name: Bulma.Elements

aliases.name: ButtonModifiers
aliases.type: { disabled : Basics.Bool, outlined : Basics.Bool, inverted : Basics.Bool, rounded : Basics.Bool, static : Basics.Bool, size : Bulma.Modifiers.Size, state : Bulma.Modifiers.State, color : Bulma.Modifiers.Color, iconLeft : Maybe.Maybe ( Bulma.Modifiers.Size, List.List (Html.Attribute msg), Bulma.Elements.IconBody msg ), iconRight : Maybe.Maybe ( Bulma.Modifiers.Size, List.List (Html.Attribute msg), Bulma.Elements.IconBody msg ) }

values.name: box
values.comment:
A white box to contain other elements.
The box is simply a container with a shadow, a border, a radius, and some padding.

    myBox : Html msg
    myBox 
      = box []
        [ p [] 
          [ text "I'm the box ghost!" ]
        ]
values.type: List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Bulma.Elements.Box msg

values.name: button
values.comment:
type Msg = DoSomething
             | DoSomethingElse

    myButton : Html Msg
    myButton
      = button myButtonModifiers 
        [ onClick DoSomething ]
        [ text "Click me!" ]

    myIconButton : Html Msg
    myIconButton
      = button myButtonModifiers 
        [ onClick DoSomething ]
        [ icon [] [ Bulm.Elements.Icon.star ]
        , span [] [ text "No, click me!" ]
        ]
values.type: Bulma.Elements.ButtonModifiers msg -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Bulma.Elements.Button msg

values.name: buttonModifiers
values.comment:
The basic defaults for buttons.

    import Bulma.Modifiers exposing ( State(Blur) 
                                    , Color(Default)
                                    , Size(Standard)
                                    )
                                   
    myButtonModifiers : ButtonModifiers msg
    myButtonModifiers 
      = { disabled = False
        , outlined = False
        , inverted = False
        , size     = Standard
        , state    = Blur
        , color    = Default
        }
values.type: Bulma.Elements.ButtonModifiers msg

values.name: buttons
values.comment:
myButtons : Html Msg
    myButtons
      = buttons Left []
        [ button { buttonModifiers | color = Success } [ text "Save changes"      ]
        , button { buttonModifiers | color = Primary } [ text "Save and continue" ]
        , button { buttonModifiers | color = Danger  } [ text "Cancel"            ]
        ]
values.type: Bulma.Modifiers.HorizontalAlignment -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Bulma.Elements.Button msg) -> Html.Html msg

values.name: connectedButtons
values.comment:
myConnectedButtons : Html Msg
    myConnectedButtons
      = connectedButtons Left []
        [ button   buttonModifiers                     [ text "Yes"   ]
        , button { buttonModifiers | color = Primary } [ text "Maybe" ]
        , button   buttonModifiers                     [ text "No"    ]
        ]
values.type: Bulma.Modifiers.HorizontalAlignment -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Bulma.Elements.Button msg) -> Html.Html msg

values.name: content
values.comment:
A single class to handle WYSIWYG-generated content, where only HTML tags are available.

    import Bulma.Modifiers exposing (Size(Standard))

    myContent : Html msg
    myContent
      = content Standard []
        [ p [] [ text "Lorem ipsum..." ] 
        ]
        
It can handle almost any HTML element, including:
- `p`
- `ul` / `ol` / `dl`
- `h1` through `h6`
- `blockquote`
- `em` & `strong`
- `table`, `tr`, `th`, and `td` tables
values.type: Bulma.Modifiers.Size -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Bulma.Elements.Content msg

values.name: delete
values.comment: Versatile delete cross.
values.type: List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Bulma.Elements.Delete msg

values.name: deleteTag
values.comment:
myMultitag : Html msg
    myMultitag
      = multitag []
        [ myMainTag
        , myDeleteTag
        ]

    myDeleteTag : Html msg
    myDeleteTag
      = deleteTag myTagModifiers [ onClick DeleteTag ]
        "Delete me!"
values.type: Bulma.Elements.TagModifiers -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Bulma.Elements.Tag msg

values.name: easyButton
values.comment:

             | DoSomethingElse

    myEasyButton : Html Msg
    myEasyButton
      = easyButton myButtonModifiers []
        DoSomethingElse
        "Click me!"

values.name: easyDelete
values.comment:
type Msg = DeleteMsg

    myEasyDelete : Html Msg
    myEasyDelete
      = easyDelete [] DeleteMsg
values.type: List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> msg -> Bulma.Elements.Delete msg

values.name: easyImage
values.comment:
myEasyImage : Html msg
    myEasyImage
      = easyImage Natural []
        "http://i.imgur.com/I47PSAO.png"
values.type: Bulma.Elements.ImageShape -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> String.String -> Bulma.Elements.Image msg

values.name: easyPlaceholderImage
values.comment:
This is a quick and dirty way to make placeholder images, using sources like http://bulma.io/images/placeholders/16x16.png .

    -- OneByOne X16       ->  16 X  16
    -- OneByOne X24       ->  24 X  24
    -- OneByOne X32       ->  32 X  32
    -- OneByOne X48       ->  48 X  48
    -- OneByOne X64       ->  64 X  64
    -- OneByOne X96       ->  96 X  96
    -- OneByOne X128      -> 128 X 128
    -- OneByOne Unbounded -> 256 X 256
    -- FourByThree        -> 640 X 480
    -- ThreeByTwo         -> 480 X 320
    -- SixteenByNine      -> 640 X 360
    -- TwoByOne           -> 640 X 320
    -- _                  -> 256 X 256

    myEasyPlaceholderImage : Html msg
    myEasyPlaceholderImage
      = easyPlaceholderImage (OneByOne Unbounded) []
values.type: Bulma.Elements.ImageShape -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> Bulma.Elements.Image msg

values.name: easyProgress
values.comment:
myProgressBar : Float -> Html msg
    myProgressBar percentCompleted
      = progress myProgressModifiers []
        percentCompleted
values.type: Bulma.Elements.ProgressModifiers -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> Basics.Float -> Bulma.Elements.Progress msg

myTag : Html msg

      = easyTag myTagModifiers []
        "That was easy."

    myTag : Id -> Html Msg

      = tagWithDelete myTagModifiers []
        (DeleteTag id)
        "cooler"

        [ text "EPISODE V" ]
        [ text "THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK" ]

values.name: image
values.comment:
Use the `image` container to specify a precisely-sized container so that your layout isn't broken because of loading or broken images.

    myImage : Html msg
    myImage
      = image FourByThree []
        [ img [ src "https://i.imgur.com/pPjvmVS.jpg" ] []
        ]

values.name: multitag
values.comment:
myMultitag : Html msg
    myMultitag
      = multitag []
        [ myFirstTag
        , mySecondTag
        ]

    myMultitags : Html msg
    myMultitags
      = multilineFields []
        [ control myControlModifiers []
          [ myMultiTag 
          ]
        , control myControlModifiers []
          [ myMultiTag 
          ]
        , control myControlModifiers []
          [ myMultiTag 
          ]
        ]
values.type: List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Bulma.Elements.Tag msg) -> Html.Html msg

values.name: notificationWithDelete
values.comment:
import Bulma.Modifiers exposing (Color(Success))
    
    type Msg = ClearNotificationsMsg

    myNotification : Html Msg
    myNotification
      = notificationWithDelete Danger []
        ClearNotificationsMsg
        [ text "Something went right!"
        ]
values.type: Bulma.Modifiers.Color -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> msg -> List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Bulma.Elements.Notification msg

values.name: progress
values.comment:
myProgressBar : Int -> Int -> Html msg
    myProgressBar pVal pMax
      = progress myProgressModifiers 
        [ value <| toString pVal
        , max   <| toString pMax
        ] 
        []

name: Bulma.Form

aliases.name: ControlInputModifiers
aliases.type: { size : Bulma.Modifiers.Size, state : Bulma.Modifiers.State, color : Bulma.Modifiers.Color, expanded : Basics.Bool, rounded : Basics.Bool, readonly : Basics.Bool, disabled : Basics.Bool, iconLeft : Maybe.Maybe ( Bulma.Modifiers.Size, List.List (Html.Attribute msg), Bulma.Elements.IconBody msg ), iconRight : Maybe.Maybe ( Bulma.Modifiers.Size, List.List (Html.Attribute msg), Bulma.Elements.IconBody msg ) }

aliases.name: ControlModifiers
aliases.type: { loading : Maybe.Maybe Bulma.Modifiers.Size, expanded : Basics.Bool, iconLeft : Maybe.Maybe ( Bulma.Modifiers.Size, List.List (Html.Attribute msg), Bulma.Elements.IconBody msg ), iconRight : Maybe.Maybe ( Bulma.Modifiers.Size, List.List (Html.Attribute msg), Bulma.Elements.IconBody msg ) }

aliases.name: ControlSelectModifiers
aliases.type: { size : Bulma.Modifiers.Size, state : Bulma.Modifiers.State, color : Bulma.Modifiers.Color, expanded : Basics.Bool, iconLeft : Maybe.Maybe ( Bulma.Modifiers.Size, List.List (Html.Attribute msg), Bulma.Elements.IconBody msg ) }

aliases.name: ControlTextAreaModifiers
aliases.type: { size : Bulma.Modifiers.Size, state : Bulma.Modifiers.State, color : Bulma.Modifiers.Color, readonly : Basics.Bool, disabled : Basics.Bool }

values.name: connectedFields
values.comment:
This is a container for gluing controls together on the same line. 
This variation will connect them as "addons".

    myFields : Html msg
    myFields
      = connectedFields Centered []
        [ controlInput myControlInputModifiers [] [] [] 
        , control myControlModifiers []
          [ button myButtonModifiers [] []
          ]
        ]
values.type: Bulma.Modifiers.HorizontalAlignment -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Bulma.Form.Control msg) -> Bulma.Form.Field msg

values.name: control
values.comment:
Controls are containers for singlular form controls.
They can only contain the folling elements:
- `label` (for radio and checkbox)
- `input`
- `select`
- `button`
- `icon`

You really shouldn't need to use this function.
`controlLabel`, `controlButton`, `controlInput`, etc. should be everything you need.
values.type: Bulma.Form.ControlModifiers msg -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Bulma.Form.Control msg

values.name: controlButton
values.comment:
type Msg = DoSomething
    
    myButton : Html Msg
    myButton
      = let myControlAttrs : List (Attribute Msg)
            myControlAttrs = []
            myButtonAttrs   : List (Attribute Msg)
            myButtonAttrs   = [ onClick DoSomething ]

        in  controlButton myButtonModifiers 
            myControlAttrs
            myButtonAttrs
            [ text "Click me!"
            ]
values.type: Bulma.Elements.ButtonModifiers msg -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Bulma.Form.Control msg

values.name: controlCheckBox
values.comment:
type Msg = UpdateChoice Bool
    
    myCheckBox : Html Msg
    myCheckBox
      = let myControlAttrs  : List (Attribute Msg)
            myControlAttrs  = []
            myLabelAttrs    : List (Attribute Msg)
            myLabelAttrs    = []
            myCheckBoxAttrs : List (Attribute Msg)
            myCheckBoxAttrs = [ onCheck UpdateChoice ]

        in  controlCheckBox False
            myControlAttrs
            myLabelAttrs
            myCheckBoxAttrs
            [ text "I don't agree to the terms and conditions"
            ]
values.type: Bulma.Form.IsDisabled -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Bulma.Form.Control msg

values.name: controlEmail
values.comment: Just like `controlInput`, but with the `type="email"` attribute added to the input.
values.type: Bulma.Form.ControlInputModifiers msg -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Bulma.Form.Control msg

values.name: controlHelp
values.comment: Secretly just `help`. Created this just for consistency.
values.type: Bulma.Modifiers.Color -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Bulma.Form.Control msg

values.name: controlInput
values.comment:
type Msg = UpdateName String

    myInput : Html Msg
    myInput
      = let myControlAttrs : List (Attribute Msg)
            myControlAttrs = []
            myInputAttrs   : List (Attribute Msg)
            myInputAttrs   = [ onInput UpdateName 
                             , placeholder "Name"
                             ]

        in  controlInput myControlInputModifiers 
            myControlAttrs
            myInputAttrs
            []
values.type: Bulma.Form.ControlInputModifiers msg -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Bulma.Form.Control msg

values.name: controlInputModifiers
values.type: Bulma.Form.ControlInputModifiers msg

values.name: controlLabel
values.comment:
Secretly the same thing as a label. This is just for consistency's sake.

    myLabel : Html msg
    myLabel
      = controlLabel [] [ text "hello" ]
values.type: List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Bulma.Form.Control msg

values.name: controlModifiers
values.type: Bulma.Form.ControlModifiers msg

values.name: controlMultiselect
values.comment: Accepts options just like `controlSelect`, except it allows you to select multiple list items.
values.type: Bulma.Form.ControlSelectModifiers msg -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Bulma.Form.Option msg) -> Bulma.Form.Control msg

values.name: controlPassword
values.comment: Just like `controlInput`, but with the `type="password"` attribute added to the input.
values.type: Bulma.Form.ControlInputModifiers msg -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Bulma.Form.Control msg

values.name: controlPhone
values.comment: Just like `controlInput`, but with the `type="tel"` attribute added to the input.
values.type: Bulma.Form.ControlInputModifiers msg -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Bulma.Form.Control msg

values.name: controlRadio
values.comment:
type Msg = UpdateChoice String
    
    myRadio : Html Msg
    myRadio
      = let myControlAttrs : List (Attribute Msg)
            myControlAttrs = []
            myLabelAttrs   : List (Attribute Msg)
            myLabelAttrs   = []
            myRadioAttrs   : List (Attribute Msg)
            myRadioAttrs   = [ onInput UpdateChoice ]

        in  controlRadio myControlAttrs
            [ controlRadioButton False False "yes"
              myLabelAttrs
              (value "1" :: myRadioAttrs)
              [ text "yep" ]
            , controlRadioButton False True "no"
              myLabelAttrs
              (value "0" :: myRadioAttrs)
              [ text "nope" ]
            , controlRadioButton True False "maybe"
              myLabelAttrs
              (value "0" :: myRadioAttrs)
              [ text "uhh" ]
            ]
values.type: List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Bulma.Form.RadioButton msg) -> Bulma.Form.Control msg

values.name: controlRadioButton
values.type: Bulma.Form.IsDisabled -> Bulma.Form.IsChecked -> String.String -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Bulma.Form.RadioButton msg

values.name: controlSelect
values.comment:
type Msg = UpdateChoice String
    
    myOption : (String,String) -> Html msg
    myOption (key,val)
      = option [ value val ]
        [ text key
        ]

    mySelect : Html Msg
    mySelect
      = let myControlAttrs  : List (Attribute Msg)
            myControlAttrs  = []
            mySelectAttrs : List (Attribute Msg)
            mySelectAttrs = [ onInput UpdateChoice ]

        in  controlSelect myControlModifiers 
            myControlAttrs
            mySelectAttrs
        <|  List.map myOption
        <|  [ (   "grow", "eat me"   )
            , ( "shrink", "drink me" )
            ]
values.type: Bulma.Form.ControlSelectModifiers msg -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Bulma.Form.Option msg) -> Bulma.Form.Control msg

values.name: controlSelectModifiers
values.type: Bulma.Form.ControlSelectModifiers msg

values.name: controlSelectRounded
values.comment: A rounded variation of `controlSelect`.
values.type: Bulma.Form.ControlSelectModifiers msg -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Bulma.Form.Control msg

values.name: controlText
values.comment: Just like `controlInput`, but with the `type="text"` attribute added to the input.
values.type: Bulma.Form.ControlInputModifiers msg -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Bulma.Form.Control msg

values.name: controlTextArea
values.comment:
type Msg = UpdateDesc String

    myTextArea : Html Msg
    myTextArea
      = let myControlAttrs  : List (Attribute Msg)
            myControlAttrs  = []
            myTextAreaAttrs : List (Attribute Msg)
            myTextAreaAttrs = [ onInput UpdateDesc
                              , placeholder "Description"
                              ]

        in  controlTextArea myControlTextAreaModifiers 
            myControlAttrs
            myTextAreaAttrs
            []
values.type: Bulma.Form.ControlTextAreaModifiers -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Bulma.Form.Control msg

values.name: controlTextAreaModifiers
values.type: Bulma.Form.ControlTextAreaModifiers

values.name: field
values.comment:
Fields are containers for Controls.
Usually this will be a single `control`, with optional an `label` and `help`.

    import Bulma.Form exposing ( field
                               , label
                               , controlInput
                               , controlModifiers
                               , help
                               )

    myField : Html msg
    myField
      = field []
        [ controlLabel [] []
        , controlInput myControlInputModifiers [] [] [] 
        , controlHelp Default [] []
        ]
values.type: List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Bulma.Form.Control msg) -> Bulma.Form.Field msg

values.name: fieldBody
values.type: List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Bulma.Form.Field msg) -> Bulma.Form.HorizontalFieldPartition msg

values.name: fieldLabel
values.type: Bulma.Modifiers.Size -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Bulma.Form.Control msg) -> Bulma.Form.HorizontalFieldPartition msg

values.name: fields
values.comment:
This is a container for gluing controls together on the same line. 
This variation will leave spaces between each control.

    myFields : Html msg
    myFields
      = fields Right []
        [ controlInput myControlInputModifiers [] [] [] 
        , control myControlModifiers []
          [ button myButtonModifiers [] []
          ]
        ]
values.type: Bulma.Modifiers.HorizontalAlignment -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Bulma.Form.Control msg) -> Bulma.Form.Field msg

values.name: help
values.type: Bulma.Modifiers.Color -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Html.Html msg

values.name: horizontalFields
values.type: List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Bulma.Form.HorizontalFieldPartition msg) -> Bulma.Form.Field msg

values.name: label
values.comment:
Just a simple label.

    myLabel : Html msg
    myLabel
      = label [] [ text "hi" ]
values.type: List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Html.Html msg

values.name: multilineFields
values.comment:
This is a container for gluing controls together when you expect it to take up multiple lines.

    myControlButton : String -> Html msg
    myControlButton buttonText
      = control myControlModifiers []
        [ button myButtonModifiers []
          [ text buttonText ]
        ]

    myFields : Html msg
    myFields
      = multilineFields []
     <| List.map myControlButton
     <| List.map toString
     <| List.range 0 10
values.type: List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Bulma.Form.Control msg) -> Bulma.Form.Field msg

name: Bulma.Layout

aliases.name: HeroModifiers
aliases.type: { bold : Basics.Bool, size : Bulma.Modifiers.Size, color : Bulma.Modifiers.Color }

values.name: centeredLevel
values.comment:
myLevel : Html msg
    myLevel
      = centeredLevel []
        [ levelItem [] []
        , levelItem [] []
        , levelItem [] []
        ]
values.type: List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Bulma.Layout.LevelItem msg) -> Bulma.Layout.Level msg

values.name: container
values.comment:
A simple container to center your content horizontally.

    myContainer : Html msg
    myContainer
      = container []
        [ p []
          [ text "My container is centered on a desktop!"
          ]
        ]

Containers can be used in any context, but mostly as a direct child of:
- `navbar`
- `hero`
- `section`
- `footer`
values.type: List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Bulma.Layout.Container msg

values.name: easyHero
values.comment:
The `hero` element with some added guard-rails.

    myHero : Html msg
    myHero
      = easyHero myHeroModifiers []
        { head = heroHead [] []
        , body = heroBody [] []
        , foot = heroFoot [] []
        }
values.type: Bulma.Layout.HeroModifiers -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> { head : Bulma.Layout.HeroPartition msg, body : Bulma.Layout.HeroPartition msg, foot : Bulma.Layout.HeroPartition msg } -> Bulma.Layout.Hero msg

values.name: easyLevelItemWithHeading
values.type: List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> String.String -> String.String -> Bulma.Layout.LevelItem msg

values.name: fluidContainer
values.comment:
If you don't want to have a maximum width, but want to keep the 24px margin on the left and right sides, `fluidContainer` is for you!

    myFluidContainer : Html msg
    myFluidContainer
      = container []
        [ p []
          [ text "My container will have a 24px gap on its left and right."
          ]
        [ p []
          [ text "This gap holds for all viewport sizes."
          ]
        ]
values.type: List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Bulma.Layout.Container msg

values.name: footer
values.type: List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Bulma.Layout.Footer msg

values.name: fullHDContainer
values.comment:
This container is full-width until the "fullHD" breakpoint.

    fullHDContainer : Html msg
    fullHDContainer
      = widescreenContainer []
        [ p [] [ text "This container fills the screen-width..." ]
        , p [] [ text "...until it hits the fullHD breakpoint." ]
        ]
values.type: List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Bulma.Layout.Container msg

values.name: hero
values.type: Bulma.Layout.HeroModifiers -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Bulma.Layout.HeroPartition msg) -> Bulma.Layout.Hero msg

values.name: heroBody
values.type: List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Bulma.Layout.HeroPartition msg

values.name: heroFoot
values.type: List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Bulma.Layout.HeroPartition msg

values.name: heroHead
values.type: List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Bulma.Layout.HeroPartition msg

values.name: heroModifiers
values.comment:
These are the stylistic defaults for `hero` containers.

    import B.Modifiers exposing ( Size(Standard)
                                    , Color(Default)
                                    )

    -- Small    -> "is-small"
    -- Standard -> "is-medium"
    -- Medium   -> "is-large"
    -- Large    -> "is-fullheight"

    myHeroModifiers : HeroModifiers
    myHeroModifiers
      = { bold  = False
        , size  = Large
        , color = Default
        }
values.type: Bulma.Layout.HeroModifiers

values.name: horizontalLevel
values.type: List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Bulma.Layout.LevelPartition msg) -> Bulma.Layout.Level msg

values.name: level
values.comment:
myLevel : Html msg
    myLevel
      = level []
        [ levelLeft []
          [ levelItem [] []
          , levelItem [] []
          , levelItem [] []
          ]
        , levelRight []
          [ levelItem [] []
          , levelItem [] []
          , levelItem [] []
          ]
        ]
values.type: List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Bulma.Layout.LevelPartition msg) -> Bulma.Layout.Level msg

myMediaObject : Html msg
    myMediaObject
      = media []
        [ mediaLeft    [] []
        , mediaContent [] []
        , mediaRight   [] []
        ]

values.name: tile
values.comment:
This element is a plain tile container. 
It's best used as an intermediate tile in a 2D grid. 
You can also add "is-ancestor", "is-parent", "is-child", and "is-vertical" classes to to make a custom Bulma-grid implementation.
values.type: Bulma.Modifiers.Width -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Bulma.Layout.Tile msg) -> Bulma.Layout.Tile msg

values.name: tileAncestor
values.comment:
This should always be your outer-most tile.

    myGrid : Html msg
    myGrid
      = tileAncestor Auto []
        [ tileParent Width8 [] 
          [ tileChild Auto [] []
          , tileChild Auto [] []
          ]
        , verticalTileParent Width4 [] 
          [ tileChild Auto [] []
          , tileChild Auto [] []
          ]
        ]
values.type: Bulma.Modifiers.Width -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Bulma.Layout.Tile msg) -> Html.Html msg

values.name: tileChild
values.comment: This tile holds your content! Its parent should always be `tileParent` or `verticalTileParent`.
values.type: Bulma.Modifiers.Width -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Bulma.Layout.Tile msg

values.name: tileParent
values.comment: Your tile-children must always be accompanied by a parent!
values.type: Bulma.Modifiers.Width -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Bulma.Layout.Tile msg) -> Bulma.Layout.Tile msg

values.name: verticalTile
values.comment: If you want to stack tiles vertically, use a vertical tile!
values.type: Bulma.Modifiers.Width -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Bulma.Layout.Tile msg) -> Bulma.Layout.Tile msg

values.name: verticalTileParent
values.comment: Your tile-children must always be accompanied by a parent!
values.type: Bulma.Modifiers.Width -> List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Bulma.Layout.Tile msg) -> Bulma.Layout.Tile msg

values.name: widescreenContainer
values.comment:
This container is full-width until the "widescreen" breakpoint.

    myWidescreenContainer : Html msg
    myWidescreenContainer
      = widescreenContainer []
        [ p [] [ text "This container fills the screen-width..." ]
        , p [] [ text "...until it hits the widescreen breakpoint." ]
        ]
values.type: List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Bulma.Layout.Container msg

name: Bulma.Modifiers

aliases.name: Devices
aliases.type: { mobile : a, tablet : a, desktop : a, widescreen : a, fullHD : a }

values.name: clearfix
values.comment: Fixes an element's floating children.
values.type: Html.Attribute msg

values.name: clipped
values.comment: Adds overflow:hidden.
values.type: Html.Attribute msg

values.name: display
values.comment: This sets a certain display attributes across all device sizes.
values.type: Bulma.Modifiers.Display -> Html.Attribute msg

values.name: displayByDevice
values.comment:
This sets display attributes per-device.

    tabletOnly 
      = displayByDevice 
        { mobile     = Hidden
        , tablet     = Block
        , desktop    = Hidden
        , widescreen = Hidden
        , fullHD     = Hidden
        }
values.type: Bulma.Modifiers.Devices Bulma.Modifiers.Display -> Html.Attribute msg

values.name: fullWidth
values.comment: Takes up the whole width (100%).
values.type: Html.Attribute msg

values.name: invisible
values.comment: Makes it disappear.
values.type: Html.Attribute msg

values.name: marginless
values.comment: Removes all margins.
values.type: Html.Attribute msg

values.name: overlay
values.comment: Completely covers the first-positioned parent.
values.type: Html.Attribute msg

values.name: paddingless
values.comment: Removes all paddings.
values.type: Html.Attribute msg

values.name: pulledLeft
values.comment: Moves an element to the left.
values.type: Html.Attribute msg

values.name: pulledRight
values.comment: Moves an element to the right.
values.type: Html.Attribute msg

values.name: radiusless
values.comment: Removes any radius.
values.type: Html.Attribute msg

values.name: screenReaderOnly
values.comment: Hides element visually, but keeps the element available to be announced by a screen reader.
values.type: Html.Attribute msg

values.name: shadowless
values.comment: Removes any shadow.
values.type: Html.Attribute msg

values.name: unselectable
values.comment: Prevents text from being selectable.
values.type: Html.Attribute msg

name: Bulma.Modifiers.Typography

values.name: capitalize
values.comment: Transforms the first character to each word to uppercase.
values.type: Html.Attribute msg

values.name: italicize
values.comment: Italicizes text.
values.type: Html.Attribute msg

values.name: lowercase
values.comment: Transforms all characters to lowercase.
values.type: Html.Attribute msg

values.name: textAlignment
values.comment: Aligns text.
values.type: Bulma.Modifiers.HorizontalAlignment -> Html.Attribute msg

values.name: textAlignmentByDevice
values.comment: Aligns text based on a device's viewport width.
values.type: Bulma.Modifiers.Devices Bulma.Modifiers.HorizontalAlignment -> Html.Attribute msg

values.name: textCentered
values.comment: Centers text.
values.type: Html.Attribute msg

values.name: textColor
values.comment: You can set any text to one of the 5 colors or 11 shades of grey.
values.type: Bulma.Modifiers.Typography.Color -> Html.Attribute msg

values.name: textJustified
values.comment: Justifies text.
values.type: Html.Attribute msg

values.name: textLeft
values.comment: Aligns text to the left.
values.type: Html.Attribute msg

values.name: textRight
values.comment: Aligns text to the right.
values.type: Html.Attribute msg

values.name: textSize
values.comment:
There are 7 font sizes to choose from:
- `textSize Largest   `: 3.00rem
- `textSize EvenLarger`: 2.50rem
- `textSize Larger    `: 2.00rem
- `textSize Large     `: 1.50rem
- `textSize Medium    `: 1.25rem
- `textSize Standard  `: 1.00rem
- `textSize Small     `: 0.75rem
values.type: Bulma.Modifiers.Typography.Size -> Html.Attribute msg

values.name: textSizeByDevice
values.comment: You can choose a font specific size for each viewport width.
values.type: Bulma.Modifiers.Devices Bulma.Modifiers.Typography.Size -> Html.Attribute msg

values.name: textWeight
values.comment: You can set any text to one of four font-weights.
values.type: Bulma.Modifiers.Typography.Weight -> Html.Attribute msg

values.name: uppercase
values.comment: Transforms all characters to uppercase.
values.type: Html.Attribute msg
